column4: I've been thinking about getting a dual screen videocard for my desktop.
nevyn:whats your take on this?
just pick up another cheap pci card and stick it in
: I had 1 agp and 2 pci cards with 3 screens at one point http://www.pybe.co.uk/files/temp-upload/my-office/my-office-1.jpg

how well does that work, I have integrated soundcard on my motherbord and a soundcard I put in and only one works (the motherbord one) even thought the soundcard worked fine before I moved it to this PC on ubuntu
well that answers my question
im using 2 cards at the mo on ubuntu
try to disable the ondoard on in the bios and see if ubuntu picks up the other
is it in lspci?
what for?
do lspci | grep audio in a termina
in vol prefs are the 2 choices oss and alsa?
if so thats the 2 different sound systems not 2 differnt cards
open the prefs and does it say at the end of the 2 choises OSS on one ans ALSA on the other
ok they are both picked up and with the drivers
try setting them all to alsa and the same device, see which ones the cirrus
select them in the drop down
i cant find the drop down menu is it because I am running hoary?
im on hoary
easyest thing to try 1st is to reboot and enter your bios setup
and look to see if you have an option to disable onboard sound
